attributes.action: To examine EU Directive 2004/38/EC EU - EU citizens right of abode in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
The host member state (UK) has the right to expel any EU citizen within 90 days of arrival who does not meet the above criteria and bar re-entry for a period of 12 months.

To utilise the Vagrancy Act (1838) and the Public Space Protection Order (PSPO) Anti-social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Act 2014 to expel EU vagrants, rough sleepers and beggars.
attributes.background: To ensure EU citizens entering the UK have a job offer or be self-employed, have sufficient resources and health insurance to ensure that they do not become a burden on the social assistance system or are following a course of study and have sufficient funds and health insurance.
